summary.para: Called when a user interacts with a toast in the action center.

param.name: appUserModelId
param.para: The unique identifier representing your app to the notification platform.

param.name: invokedArgs
param.para: Arguments from the invoked button. NULL if the toast indicates the default activation and no launch arguments were specified in the XML payload.

param.name: data
param.para: The data from the input elements available on the notification toast.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: In order for your app to respond to toasts in the action center, you need to override this method in your app. You also will need to create a shortcut on the start menu. For more information about how to respond to activation notifications, see Respond to toast activations.
If your application uses non-interactive toasts, you can respond to those without using invokedArgs or data.
If you return a failure code, the activation will fail and the user can try again to activate your app.

summary.para: Receives notification messages when an app is triggered through a toast from the action center.
